instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00875 missing PP5V_S4
threads.message:
Hi,

I have a board here that won't power on after a liquid spill. U7650 and Q7660 were badly corroded so I have replaced them. After cleaning the board in the ultrasonic cleaner, the rest of the board looks OK. It's missing PP5V_S4. I'm testing using an original Apple 87W USB type C charger and cable from Apple. Here are the readings I have so far:

PPBUS_G3H = 13V
PP5V_S5 = 5V
PP3V3_S5 = 3.3V
PP5V_S4 = 0V  31K to gnd on that line

SMC_PM_G2_EN = 3.4V
PM_SLP_S4_L = 0V
ALL_SYS_PWRGD = 0V

Any and all advice welcome :)

Cheers,

Alex

threads.title: 820-00875 missing PP5V_S4
threads.message:
Well yeah, this could be absolutely everything. Must be corrosion somewhere else but you have cleaned it already :(

U1900 area checked? 32KHz on pin 10? PP3V1_RTC present?

threads.title: 820-00875 missing PP5V_S4
threads.message:
Hi Duke,

U1900 area looks good. 
U1900 32KHz is present on pin 10 checked with scope.
PP3V1_RTC = 3.08V

I took photos of the board before cleaning. Saved them to google drive here:
[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1uiVSqKi5rLoeHLZWtXaafn71gdXTvMkq/view?usp=sharing[/url]
[url]https://drive.google.com/file/d/1arVa7uBB4JKSqqBhqew9Uq45KTcjdgig/view?usp=sharing[/url]

If you have time to take a look at the photos I would appreciate it. Thanks for your help :)

threads.title: 820-00875 missing PP5V_S4
threads.message:
Pictures are of no use, no detail or resolution.

Is there any power cycling on PP5V_S4? Check with scope as multimeter may be too slow to catch it.

threads.title: 820-00875 missing PP5V_S4
threads.message: Yeah, I'm getting a really short pulse every ~4 seconds.

threads.title: 820-00875 missing PP5V_S4
threads.message: Hi Duke, it sprung to life while I was probing it with the CRO probe... PP5V_S4 and all the other rails are now present. I'm sure the problem is related to U7650 but visually it looks fine. I'm going to reflow it with some flux and a bit of solder just incase. I really don't like situations like this where it's not totally clear what the problem and solution was. Thanks a lot for your help :)
